questions.text: Who is the author of 'The Cat in the Hat'?
questions.explanation: Dr. Seuss (Theodor Geisel) wrote The Cat in the Hat in 1957.

questions.text: In what language was 'Don Quixote' originally written?
questions.explanation: Don Quixote was written in Spanish by Miguel de Cervantes in 1605.

questions.text: What is the name of the hobbit in 'The Hobbit'?
questions.explanation: Bilbo Baggins is the protagonist of J.R.R. Tolkien's The Hobbit (1937).

questions.text: What literary device is 'The wind whispered through the trees'?
questions.explanation: Personification gives human qualities (whispering) to non-human things (wind).

questions.text: What is the setting of Gabriel García Márquez's 'One Hundred Years of Solitude'?
